page.title: 14LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The western boundary of the parish of Braceby and Sapperton runs along Long Hollow, on the line of Roman road linking Bourne with Ancaster. South west of Sapperton village a{Roman settlement has been under excavation since 1974. By their names, Sapperton is{Saxon}in origin and Braceby is {Danish.}For more than 700 years from the time of Domesday 1085 the two villages formed part of the Soke of Grantham. Both villages have churches dating from around the{13th century; the Manor House at Sapperton and the three farmhhouses at Braceby all date from around the{17th century.}The middle of the{20th century}saw the villages in steady decline, as the population moved away and houses were left empty. Since the early 1970's this decline has been reversed, with many houses having been modernised.
